page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
This{rural area,}centred on { {Cadson Bury Hill,}lies immediately to the South West of the growing commuter town of{Callington. }It remains a peaceful slice of the slow moving Cornish countryside, with the steep undulating land being used mainly for {livestock farming.
The total{population}of the area} is no more than{100,}most of whom live in individual farmhouses scattered throughout the region.
Only two{settlements}are of any size:{Frogwell}(a hamlet centred on 2 farms and a chapel) and{Newbridge}(a mere cluster of buildings where the A390 road to Liskeard crosses the River Lynher).
